008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the calculation of horizontal and vertical
019 * projections on a grayscale image. See Sec. 8.7 of [1] for additional details.
020 * The resulting projections are shown as separate images, the original image is
021 * not modified.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
025 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2020/12/17
030 */
031public class Make_Projections implements PlugInFilter {
032        
033        /** Size of horizontal/vertical projection bars. */
034        static final int PSIZE = 150;
035        /** Foreground value for drawing (black). */
036        static final int FOREGROUND = 0;
037        /** Background value for drawing (white). */
038        static final int BACKGROUND = 255;
039        
040        ImagePlus im = null;
041        
042        @Override
043        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) { 
044                this.im = im;
045                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
046        }
047        
048        @Override
049        public void run(ImageProcessor I) {
050                int M = I.getWidth();
051                int N = I.getHeight();
052                int[] pHor = new int[N];
053                int[] pVer = new int[M];
054                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
055                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
056                                int p = I.getPixel(u, v);
057                                pHor[v] +=  p;
058                                pVer[u] +=  p;
059                        }
060                }
061                
062                // make the horizontal projection:
063                ByteProcessor hP = new ByteProcessor(PSIZE,N);
064                hP.setValue(BACKGROUND); hP.fill();
065                hP.setValue(FOREGROUND);
066                double maxWhite = M * 255;
067                for (int row = 0; row < N; row++) {
068                        double black = (1 - pHor[row] / maxWhite);      // percentage of black in line 'row'
069                        int k = (int) (black * PSIZE);
070                        if (k > 0) {
071                                hP.drawLine(0, row, k, row);
072                        }
073                }
074                (new ImagePlus("Horizontal projection", hP)).show();
075                                
076                // make the vertical projection:
077                ByteProcessor vP = new ByteProcessor(M,PSIZE);
078                vP.setValue(BACKGROUND); vP.fill();
079                vP.setValue(FOREGROUND);
080                maxWhite = N * 255;
081                for (int col = 0; col < M; col++) {
082                        double black = (1 - pVer[col] / maxWhite);      // percentage of black in column 'col'
083                        int k = (int) (black * PSIZE);
084                        if (k > 0) {
085                                vP.drawLine(col, 0, col, k);
086                        }
087                }
088                (new ImagePlus("Vertical projection", vP)).show();
089        }
090
091}
